name: Blythswood Square

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Blythswood Square for one night, but it felt like home by the time we left. We arrived cranky, and jet-lagged after travelling non-stop for over 24 hours. The staff were kind and efficient, and we were quickly shown to very nice room on the Mezzanine floor. The room was large and comfortable, with cute modern furniture. As it was Boxing Day, the thermal spa was available for hotel guests to use all day. Relaxing in the spa was the perfect way to recover from our flights. We had the continental breakfast the next morning, which was included in our room rate, and it was quite good. The hotel is in a great location, overlooking a charming square. Great value for the rate we paid, and we would definitely stay at the Blythswood again.
reviews.title: A great stay in Glasgow

reviews.text: Blythswood is one of my favourite venues in Glasgow both for dining and cocktails however I continue to be frustrated by the inconsistency, particularly in terms of service, that is offered.
reviews.title: Lovely - but not a 5 star experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My last visit on 18 December 2012 was to have a pre-Christmas meal with friends. We went to the first floor lounge to enjoy pre-dinner cocktails but had probably the worst service I have ever received here. Despite the lounge being relatively quiet and at least 4 bar staff on it took almost 20 minutes to be served and a further 15 to get our drinks. On the plus side we were offered those drinks on the house without ever raising the delay as an issue!!
reviews.title: Very good, but not yet 5 star, hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The restaurant is stunningly decorated and I find the service here generally good. The food is not the best available in Glasgow and the menu's do lack imagination however everything we had we enjoyed and it is beautifully presented.
reviews.title: 5 Star Bliss

reviews.text: Part of the magic for me in dining at the Blythswood is the lively, vibrant atmosphere in the restaurant. Unfortunatley on the night we dined (one week before Christmas) the place was virtually deserted by 9.30pm with more serving staff than diners. This was made all the more uncomfortable by our seating position in the centre of the restaurant!
reviews.title: Classy without being pretentious. Most welcoming.
Beautiful "boutique feel" hotel with top notch service
reviews.text: We booked for 3 nights and had a great stay in Glasgow, partially thanks to a very comfortable home away from home.The service is excellent all throughout - special mention of concierge David who will get "special guests" a table at the restaurant even if it is fully booked. Spa is beautiful but no proper swimming pool. Breakfast is really good - if it is included in the booking then you are able to order from the a la carte menu free of charge (which we found out only on the last day unfortunately!).

Attended a family celebration dinner recently in this luxuriously refurbished hotel. It looks fabulous with clever nods to the infamous nature of the location's history as well as plenty of vintage automobile images scatterd about. We started with drinks in the upstairs bar and the staff couldn't have been more helpful in arranging a table big enough for the whole party. We ate in the restaurant and chose from the festive menu, which featured interesting touches such as lettuce ice cream. I had the seam bream as a main course, which was tasty, with a lovely crispy skin. The portion sizes were,perhaps, slightly on the small side, although after cheese instead of dessert, I was sated. The service was friendly and efficient and all in all it was a very pleasant experience, I would certainly eat there again.
reviews.title: Enjoyable meal in lovely surroundings

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Blythswood Square for three nights and have only positive things to say. The hotel is situated in an old beautiful building and is smartly furnished with a tasteful mixture between old and new. The staff in the reception were courteous and helpful and there always seemed to be enough behind the desk to help all guests at once. Our room was on the second floor and was really pleasant, with a huge bathroom (and a great shower!), a very comfortable bed and a separate space for the luggage. The only thing that could be said against the room was that the view was rather dull, but this did not bother us. The spa is available for hotel guests for free every day between 6am-9am and 6pm-9pm and was well worth a visit! It was very fresh and had all the different functions that should be expected from a good spa. Also, the hotel bar deserves mentioning. Even though it was a very popular bar, the staff always managed to find us seating, and the cocktails were just excellent!
reviews.title: Excellent hotel at perfect location

reviews.text: The hotel is located in a fashionable but quiet part of Glasgow, surrounded by low sandstone buildings, seemingly mainly office buildings, but the city centre with shopping and restaurants was only a 5 minute walk away. Passing a few other hotels during our visit, we felt lucky we were staying at the Blythswood square, and would definitely recommend it to anybody travelling to Glasgow.
reviews.title: All you could ever need in a hotel

reviews.text: Hats off to The Blythswood square, everything you could want in a hotel and more. The rooms were excellently appointed and everything was top notch. The breakfast was also excellent ( liked the touch where they provided a bottle of Vodka and all the necessary goodies to make a Bloody Mary on the breakfast buffet). The staff were extremely pleasant and welcoming and couldn't do enough to help. Would defo return for sure
reviews.title: Cocktails

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the Blythswood Square Hotel for 1 night in a Deluxe room (100) for my wifes birthday just after christmas. The room was right beside reception and the main foyer, but there was a private mini-corridor and an extra door to help keep out any noise.
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was of a good size with a comfy four poster bed and a lovely large bathroom with rainfall shower and a seperate free standing bath. The only issue with the room was a spot of water damage on the ceiling and walls in the bathroom, but it's hardly worth mentioning.
reviews.title: GORGEOUS!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had dinner in the hotel restaurant which was delicious, and afterwards had drinks in the 1st floor Salon cocktail bar. The service in both the restaurant and the bar was very friendly, if a little slow (25 minutes from drinks order to delivery!) but the bar was kept open until we decided to head to bed at 4am, and the drinks were excellent.
reviews.title: Service on a Go-Slow

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We took advantage of the wonderful Spa which was surprisingly quiet - no more than 12 people using the 7/8 facilities in the 90 minutes we were in there. It's the best spa I've ever used, even if it is a bit pricey. It felt very classy and exclusive, as did the hotel as a whole.
reviews.title: beautiful and funky

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Gorgeous hotel, staff cannot do enough for you. Rooms are immaculately presented and the decor is stunning. Everything is done to perfection. Beds were very comfy.
reviews.title: Great stay at the Blythswood
Still Excellent
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at Blythswood in July of this year and loved our stay so we were excited to return again as part of a pre-Christmas break. We arrived at the hotel at noon, well before the check in time, and so were really only expecting to drop our bags off before heading out to do some Christmas shopping. It was a pleasant surprise to be told our room was ready. We booked a classic room again and were given a room on the 3rd floor. Our room was on the 5th floor last time and I have to admit that I preferred being on the 5th floor. I have absolutely no complaints about the room though and the bed is still one of the most comfortable I have slept in. On our last visit I mentioned that I was disappointed by the breakfast service, not the case this time. Staff were organised and attentive and so it felt it only right to submit this review to reflect this. Hopefully we will return again soon as we were out and about so I didn't get a chance to visit the spa or sample the delicious cocktails.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for 1 night on the 17th of November - our third stay at this lovely hotel. There was only 1 room available which happened to be a suite, so we happily booked that. It was a lovely big room with a seating area and dining table in it, and views of the square. Our only issue was that the TV was very far away from the bed, which wasn't convenient when watching a film from bed later on.
reviews.title: Our 3rd stay here, lovely relaxing break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked the stay so we could use the spa facilities during the day and then spend time with my sister in the evening. So we asked at check-in about use of the spa during the day and we were advised that we should ring down to the spa from our room and if it's quiet then we might not get charged for the spa. So my husband made the call and explained that I was eight months pregnant and just wanted to use the swimming pool. We were told that there would be a charge and they would tell me when we got there which of the spa facilities I would be able to use. So we spent two hours in the spa. I had a swim then went to lie in the relaxation room and my husband tried the various steam rooms and tepidarium (heated beds). We really enjoyed this time to relax and happily, we were not charged for this experience.
reviews.title: Excellent venue
Relaxing spa
reviews.text: We spent the evening in the hotel bar with my sister, enjoying the drinks and surroundings (apart from when we went out for dinner). The cocktail menu was limited as they said it was being changed, but they managed to make the drinks we asked for, including non-alcoholic cocktails for myself.

Breakfast was excellent, apart from a few service issues. They forgot to bring our toast and my husband was sitting for a good five minutes with a plate of sausages and bacon and nothing to put it on. I made myself a bowl of granola from the buffet and also ordered a bagel and cream cheese - perfect.
reviews.title: My Choice In My Own City

description: Blythswood Square is more than a hotel and is an exciting addition to Glasgow's city centre. Not only does it have 100 stunning guest rooms but it also houses an amazing spa, restaurant, salon bar and private event areas, a true 5 star proposition.
